The value selected here will be the default for file processing in versions created by this administrator.

Keep a copy of the original files

Permission level assigned to this administrator.

Version managers cannot edit generic listings.

Full control means that the administrator has the power to edit any content on the portal, including other administrators.

Most administrators are listing and version managers.

Password that the administrator will use to log in.

It is advisable to generate it with a password generator, and for the administrator to change it when logging in for the first time.

Must be a JPEG file and have a minimum size of 1920×1080 pixels (or the same resolution but in portrait mode).
admin.advent_edit.header_image.help:
Image used as a header in the anime, manga and live action portals (in the recommendations section) during the advent calendar period.

It must be a JPEG file and have a minimum size of 1920×400 pixels.
admin.advent_edit.image.help:

It must be a JPEG file and have an exact size of 512×512 pixels.

admin.advent_edit.preview_image.help:

Must be a JPEG file and have a minimum size of 1200×600 pixels.
admin.advent_edit.url_and_description.he:
Link where the box of the specified day points to once it has been opened.

It can be an external URL or from the %s portal.

The description is shown under the image in the promotional videos with the box opening that are created manually each day.

The format is “Fansub name | Content title”.

admin.fansub_edit.archive_url.help:
Full URL of the fansub website on Archive.org.

Only filled in when the fansub is historical: in this case, the field is required.
admin.fansub_edit.bluesky_handle.help:
Fansub profile identifier on Bluesky including the at sign.

If it doesn’t have one, you must input the full name of the fansub.

It is used to mention the fansub in posts.
admin.fansub_edit.bluesky_url.help:
Full URL of the fansub’s profile on Bluesky.

If there is none, leave it blank.
admin.fansub_edit.discord_url: URL of the fansub’s public Discord server
admin.fansub_edit.discord_url.help:
Full URL of the fansub’s public Discord.

If none, leave blank.
admin.fansub_edit.email.help:
Fansub e-mail address.

This is required to create the user and community profiles.
admin.fansub_edit.facebook_url.help:
Full URL of the fansub’s Facebook profile.

If there is none, leave it blank.
admin.fansub_edit.hentai_category.help:
Indicates whether the fansub publishes hentai. Used to show it on %2$s or not.

If it never publishes hentai, it will not appear on %2$s.

If it only publishes hentai, it will not appear on %1$s.

If it publishes hentai sometimes, it will appear on both portals, but the news will be filtered depending on whether they contain the words “hentai”, “yaoi” or “yuri” and the matches will only be shown on the corresponding portal.
admin.fansub_edit.icon.help:
Fansub logo that is displayed on the web in all content associated with a fansub.

It must be a PNG file of exactly 192×192 pixels.
admin.fansub_edit.instagram_url.help:
Full URL of the fansub’s Instagram profile.

If there is none, leave it blank.
admin.fansub_edit.linktree_url.help:
Full URL of the fansub’s Linktree profile.

If there is none, leave it blank.
admin.fansub_edit.mastodon_handle.help:
The fansub’s Mastodon handle including the at sign.

If it doesn’t have one, you must input the full name of the fansub.

It is used to mention the fansub in posts.
admin.fansub_edit.mastodon_url.help:
Full URL of the fansub’s Mastodon profile.

If there is none, leave it blank.
admin.fansub_edit.name: Name
admin.fansub_edit.ping_token.help:
Defines a token so that the fansub website code can make an internal call to %1$s.

It is used to force a news refresh (and in fansubs that have it set up to be fetched on demand): if a request is made to %2$s/refresh/{token}, news will be updated immediately.

If you don’t know what this is, it’s safe to leave the field blank.
admin.fansub_edit.slug.help:
Short text that will be used as part of the URL to link to content made by this fansub.

It is usually autogenerated and does not need to be edited.
admin.fansub_edit.status.help:
Specifies whether the fansub is active or historical, and if it has access to the side and therefore can reply and post comments.

Fansubs that have not published any content for more than two years are considered inactive, regardless of the status of their website.

All fansubs that have disappeared and no longer have a website are considered historical.

Contents by fansubs without access will show a warning indicating that comments may not be read by the fansub.
admin.fansub_edit.telegram_url.help:
Full URL of the fansub’s Telegram channel.

If there is none, leave it blank.
admin.fansub_edit.threads_url.help:
Full URL of the fansub’s Threads profile.

If there is none, leave it blank.
admin.fansub_edit.twitter_handle.help:
The fansub’s X handle including the at sign.

If it doesn’t have one, you must input the full name of the fansub.

It is used to mention the fansub in posts.
admin.fansub_edit.twitter_url.help:
Full URL of the fansub’s X profile.

If there is none, leave it blank.
admin.fansub_edit.type.help:
It indicates whether it is a fansub or a fandub.

If the same group makes fansubs and fandubs, you will need to create two different listings and differentiate them by name (“Fansub” and “Fansub (dubs)”, for example).
admin.fansub_edit.url.help:
Full URL of the fansub website.

If there is none, leave blank.
admin.fansub_edit.user_password.help:
User password for the public website.

This is required to create the user and community profiles.

Each fansub has a public user on the website (with a username equal to their fansub name) and can log in with this password. It can be used to reply to the community on behalf of the fansub.
admin.fansub_edit.user_password_edit: Password for the public user (only if you want to change it)
admin.fansub_edit.youtube_url.help:
Full URL of the fansub’s YouTube channel.

If there is none, leave it blank.

admin.index.explanation_analysis: In the analysis menu you will find a series of options to see what the content consumption is.
admin.index.explanation_content:
Each anime, manga or live action content contains a generic listing with its divisions (seasons or volumes) and episodes.
The versions correspond to the edition of one or more fansubs and include the corresponding links or files.
To add new content, first you must create the generic listing, and then the version with the links or files.
admin.index.explanation_doubts: If you have any questions, please check the help in the upper right or contact an administrator.
admin.index.explanation_news:
The news section allows you to manage news from the websites or blogs of the different fansubs.
Except in very specific cases, it is not necessary to add, modify or delete news manually.
admin.index.explanation_toggle: If you prefer the dashboard homepage to be not this but a summary of your fansub, click on the upper right icon.
admin.index.limited_permissions: You do not have permission to create anime, manga, or live action listings. If you need to, ask someone else to do it.
admin.index.welcome: Welcome to the admin panel. Here you can manage the content of the different %s websites.

admin.news_edit.contents.help:
Text of the body of the news that will be displayed on the website.

Important: HTML code is entered here and the website prints it without checking its validity: if it is invalid code, it can break the website.

We do not recommend using HTML code (not even bold and italic tags) due to this risk.

If you still decide to use it, make sure to close all tags correctly.
admin.news_edit.date.help: Date of the news that will be displayed on the website.
admin.news_edit.fansub.help:

It is not possible to edit it once the news has been added.

admin.news_edit.image.help: Optional image that will be displayed next to the news on the website.
admin.news_edit.title: Title
admin.news_edit.title.help: Title of the news that will be displayed on the website.
admin.news_edit.url.help:
URL to which the news will link.

News can be created without a URL, but %s is not a place to generate your own content, but a collection of all news websites.
admin.news_edit.warning_about_adding: It is usually not necessary to manually add fansub news, as they are automatically obtained through the fetchers. Make sure that this is really what you want to do, and if in doubt, contact an administrator.
admin.news_fetcher_edit.fansub.help: Fansub to which the news obtained with this fetcher will be associated.
admin.news_fetcher_edit.fetch_type.help: Frequency of news collection: periodic (normal case), on request (the fansub ping token must be configured) or one-time collection.
admin.news_fetcher_edit.method.help:

If you consider that any collection method needs to be changed or added, notify an administrator so that they can change the code.

admin.series_edit.alternate_titles.help:
Other titles that the series has can be inputted (both in the original language and in English).

It is not allowed to input titles in languages other than the original or English.

If there is more than one, they are separated by commas.
admin.series_edit.author: Author
admin.series_edit.author.help:
Full name of the original author.

The order of names in all languages is first name then last name, except in Korean, where it is last name then first name.

If there is more than one author, they are separated by commas.
admin.series_edit.comic_type.help: You must select the type of comic: manga, manhua, manhwa or light novel.
admin.series_edit.default_version.help:
This is the version that will open by default when clicking on a series in places where a specific version is not shown.

This is usually the first version made, but you can change it to a higher quality version.

Please check with an administrator before making this change.
admin.series_edit.demographics.help:
The audience the content is aimed at.

Normally, at most one is selected.

For live action content, it is not necessary to specify it.
admin.series_edit.division.help.anime:
Divisions are groupings of episodes. We could say that they are like seasons, although they don’t necessarily have to be: they can also be arcs, special episode sets, OVAs, etc.

Each anime must have one or more divisions.

If it is a single movie, it must have a single division that will contain a single episode.

If it is a set of films, it will usually have a division that will unify all the episodes, and additionally, a division without episodes for each file in MyAnimeList. If, for example, there is a grouping of specials related to the movie, they can be included in another division.

Series with more than one season must all be reported as divisions, even if they are not planned to be edited, but they can have additional divisions (for example, special episodes, OVAs or linked films).

If you want, you can register fictitious divisions with 0 episodes so that their MyAnimeList identifier is used to average with the rest of the divisions (this is useful when the divisions do not match the listings in MyAnimeList).

Check the help for each field for more information.
admin.series_edit.division.help.liveacti:
Divisions are groupings of episodes. We could say that they are like seasons, although they don’t necessarily have to be: they can also be arcs, special episode sets, OVAs, etc.

Each live action content must have one or more divisions.

If it is a single movie, it must have a single division that will contain a single episode.

If it is a set of movies, it will usually have a division that will unify all the episodes, and additionally, a division without episodes for each listing in MyDramaList. If, for example, there is a grouping of specials related to the movie, they can be included in another division.

Series with more than one season must all be reported as divisions, even if they are not planned to be edited, but they can have additional divisions (for example, special episodes, OVAs or linked films).

If you want, you can register fictitious divisions with 0 episodes so that their MyDramaList identifier is used to average with the rest of the divisions (this is useful when the divisions do not match the listings in MyDramaList).

Check the help for each field for more information.
admin.series_edit.division.help.manga:
Divisions are groupings of episodes. We could say that they are like volumes, although they don’t necessarily have to be: they can also be sets of special episodes, special volumes, etc.

Each manga must have one or more divisions.

If it is a one-shot, it must have a single division containing a single episode.

If it is a set of one-shots, it will usually have a single division (if it is a single volume) with several episodes, unless, for example, there is a grouping of specials that is worth classifying separately, which could be a second division.

Serialized manga of more than one volume must all be reported as divisions, even if they are not planned to be edited, but they can have additional divisions (for example, special episodes).

If you want, you can register fictitious divisions with 0 episodes so that their MyAnimeList identifier is used to average with the remainder of divisions (useful when divisions do not match the listings in MyAnimeList).

Check the help for each field for more information.
admin.series_edit.division_episodes.help:
You must enter the total number of episodes in the division, including special episodes and linked movies (if applicable), but not extras (which will be registered in the version and not here).

Divisions with 0 episodes will never appear in the public tab, but their %s identifier will be used to average with the rest.

If a division is unfinished (in publication or broadcast), you must enter the number of episodes it is expected to have (and register them), or edit it for each new episode that is there (you can also do this directly in the version tab).
admin.series_edit.division_external_id.h: The user score shown on the website is calculated by averaging all the different %s identifiers (including those of the divisions and the series).
admin.series_edit.division_number.help:
Used internally to reference the division and assign episodes to it, but never shown publicly.

If necessary, decimals (for example: 1.5) or the number 0 can be used.
admin.series_edit.division_real.help:
Defines whether this division counts as a season.

For example, it can be unchecked in a specials division so that specials do not count as a season.

On the public website, the work is shown as having as many seasons as divisions with the “Real” box checked.
admin.series_edit.division_real.help.man:
Defines whether this division counts as a volume.

For example, it can be unchecked in a specials division so that specials do not count as a volume.

On the public website, the work is shown as having as many volumes as divisions with the “Real” box checked.
admin.series_edit.division_title.help.an:
If the division is equivalent to a season, the season title is usually entered in the original language (not in Catalan), always using the Western alphabet version (kanji or hanja are not supported).

An internal title can also be entered if it is a division to group OVAs, specials, linked movies or similar.

It is used to identify the division internally.

The localized name is entered in the version listing.
admin.series_edit.division_title.help.li:
If the division is equivalent to a season, the season title is usually entered in the original language (not in Catalan), always using the Western alphabet version (kanji or hanja are not supported).

An internal title can also be entered if it is a division to group OVAs, specials, linked movies or similar.

It is used to identify the division internally.

The localized name is entered in the version listing
admin.series_edit.division_title.help.ma:
If the division is equivalent to a volume, it is usually entered as “Volume X”.

An internal title can also be entered if it is a division to group special episodes.

It is used to identify the division internally.

The localized name is entered in the version listing.
admin.series_edit.episode_division.help:
Specifies which division the episode belongs to.

If necessary, decimals (for example: 1.5) or the number 0 can be used.
admin.series_edit.episode_number.help:
If necessary, decimals (for example: 1.5) or the number 0 can be used.

If left blank, the episode is considered an unnumbered special episode. In this case, a special name must be entered so that it is possible to know what it refers to.
admin.series_edit.episode_special_name: Name of the special or linked movie
admin.series_edit.episode_special_name.h:
This field can only be filled in special episodes (that is, if you do not enter an episode number) or to specify a linked movie.

It is used internally to identify the special, since it cannot be done with the number because it does not have one.

Linked films are films that have an independent file (if they are films, they must have one and not belong to the series file), but that are also interesting to show in the series file.

Linking a film implies that it will be considered another chapter within a specific division, but instead of entering the links in the file of this work, it will be necessary to do so in the corresponding film file.

In the version file, a title will need to be given to the linked films.

This field can only be filled in special episodes (that is, if you do not enter a episode number).

It is used internally to identify the special, as it cannot be done with the number because it does not have one.
admin.series_edit.episodes.help:
You must register all existing episodes of the work and assign them to the corresponding division.

You can generate the episodes automatically if you have reported the number of episodes in each division and press the “Autogenerate episodes” button.

Check the help for each field for more information.
admin.series_edit.explicit_level.help:
If there is erotica of any kind, check the most appropriate option.

Currently it is only shown as a label on the website.

These labels do not influence whether a content appears on the general portal or the hentai portal, this is done based on whether the age rating is “Pornographic content” or not.
admin.series_edit.external_provider_id.h:
Corresponds to the numerical identifier in the MyAnimeList URL.

You can import it automatically if you press the “Import” button and write the entire MyAnimeList URL.

It is not mandatory, but if it is provided, it allows you to know the rating given by users and therefore it can be shown in “Top rated”, search by rating, etc.

Corresponds to the numeric identifier followed by a hyphen and the text in the MyDramaList URL.

You can import it automatically if you press the “Import” button and write the entire MyDramaList URL.

It is not mandatory, but if it is provided, it allows you to know the rating given by users and therefore it can be shown in “Top rated”, the search by score, etc.
admin.series_edit.external_provider_impo: The %s listing has been imported. Please check that the data is correct, fill in the empty fields, add any missing divisions, and complete the episode list, if applicable.
admin.series_edit.external_provider_scor:
It is displayed on the web and is used to allow filtering of content by score and to recommend high-quality content.

It cannot be modified because it is automatically obtained from %s.
admin.series_edit.genres.help: Select all the genres that fit the main plot of the content.
admin.series_edit.header.liveaction: Edit live action content - Live action
admin.series_edit.keywords.help:
This is an optional field where you can enter keywords related to the series.

For example, if we want the series “Dragon Ball” to appear when searching for “Goku”, we will put “Goku” in the keywords.

If there is more than one, they are separated by spaces.

Please do not abuse it.
admin.series_edit.launch_date.help:
Launch date of the content, if known. Allows you to filter by year of publication in the search.

If the month or day is not known, enter “01” in the corresponding boxes.
admin.series_edit.licensed_status.help:
If there is part of the work (for example, a season, a movie or a volume) that has been officially published in Catalan, you must select “Has licensed parts”.

If “Has licensed parts” is selected, an information message is displayed on the content listing.

If “Fully licensed” or “Unavailable for legal reasons” are selected, the content becomes no longer accessible and an error message is shown on its public entry.



Remember that we do not accept licensed content on the portal under any circumstances, therefore, these last two states can only be selected when retiring old content that has been licensed.
admin.series_edit.rating.help:
Recommended age to view the content.

We use the values provided on external websites (MyAnimeList, MyDramaList, etc.).

The user can filter by rating, but can always choose to view it regardless of their age.

If you check “Pornographic content”, it means that the content will not be shown on the general portal but on the hentai one.

Live action content with pornographic content is not allowed under any circumstances.
admin.series_edit.reader_type.help:
Typically, manga is usually paginated and is usually read from right to left, unless it has been westernized (in which case, it would be read from left to right).

Webtoons are usually read by scrolling through a vertical strip.

The user can read paginated comics in vertical strip mode if it is more comfortable for them, but comics designed to be read in a vertical strip can never be read paginated.
admin.series_edit.related_content.help:
Here you can add contents related to the work you are editing.

Some examples of related content would be movies or one-shots of the same work that have a separate listing, or parallel universes where the same characters appear.

Do not add works that have no relationship, even if they are by the same author, studio or theme.
admin.series_edit.related_content_elemen:
Select an item from the list to add it as related content.

The content you add here will also be related to this work (it is a two-way link).
admin.series_edit.studio.help:
Animation studio or production company of the work.

If there are more than one, they are separated by commas.
admin.series_edit.themes.help: Select all the themes that fit the main argument of the content.
admin.series_edit.title_in_original_lang:
The title must be entered in the original language (not in Catalan), always using the version in the Western alphabet (kanji or hanja are not allowed).

Later, a localized title will be entered in the listing for each version, which will be the one used primarily on the website.

Remember that each content can have more than one season (or volume): do not register a different listing for each season or volume of the same content.
admin.series_edit.type_of_work.help:
Series should be marked as “Series”, and movies as “Movie” (regardless of whether they are sets of movies or just one).

Short movies are also movies.

If a file contains only special episodes, they will also be considered movies.

We also consider OVA collections (and OVAs alone) to be movies, unless they are clearly an independent series (in which case, they would be a series).
admin.series_edit.type_of_work.help.mang:
Manga that are only one episode should be marked as “One-shot”, but if they are collections of one-shots, they should be marked as “Serialized”.

Any manga with more than one episode is “Serialized”.
admin.series_list.create_version.title: Create a version
admin.series_list.delete_confirm.anime: Are you sure you want to delete the anime “%s” and all its contents? This action cannot be undone.
admin.series_list.delete_confirm.liveact: Are you sure you want to delete the live action content “%s” and all its contents? This action cannot be undone.
admin.series_list.delete_confirm.manga: Are you sure you want to delete the manga “%s” and all its contents? This action cannot be undone.
admin.series_list.header.liveaction: Live action content list - Live action
admin.series_list.title: Title
admin.stats.anime_files_by_fansub: Number of anime files by fansub
admin.stats.anime_files_by_fansub.fansub: Number of anime files with participation %s
admin.stats.liveaction_files_by_fansub: Number of live action files per fansub
admin.stats.liveaction_files_by_fansub.f: Number of live action files with participation %s
admin.stats.manga_files_by_fansub: Number of manga files per fansub
admin.stats.manga_files_by_fansub.fansub: Number of manga files with participation %s
admin.twitter_image.nothing_seen: Nothing has been seen in this period.
admin.version_edit.add_episode_modal.exp: You will immediately add an episode to the corresponding series. If you need to add a new division or multiple episodes, exit this version, edit the series, and then edit this version again.
admin.version_edit.alternate_localized_t:
You can enter alternate localized titles for the version. For example, if you prefer to keep the title in Japanese or English, you can add the translation here. This way, if someone searches for one of these alternate titles, they will also find the corresponding version.

Only Catalan titles are allowed.

If there is more than one, they are separated by commas.
admin.version_edit.cover_image.help:
This image will be used on the web to identify this version.

The image must be in JPEG format, 300×400 pixels or larger, and less than 150 KiB in size.

If it takes up more space, reduce the resolution or JPEG compression quality.

If you make a localized version in Catalan, the result will be much nicer.
admin.version_edit.division_titles_and_c: Titles and covers for each division

Enter the title for each division and, optionally, a cover image.

This title will be used to identify the division, but also to announce new features in social media posts.

The title should never be a generic name like “Season X”, “Special episodes” or “OVAs”, because in some places on the web and on social media the title of the division is used without mentioning the series. Therefore, if applicable, you should put “Series name - Season X”, “Series name - Specials” or “Series name - OVAs”.

If a division-specific cover image is not uploaded, the version’s cover image will be displayed.

Images must be in JPEG format, 300×400 pixels or larger, and take up less than 150 KiB.

If they take up more, reduce the resolution or JPEG compression quality.

If you make a localized version in Catalan, the result will be much nicer.

Enter the title of each division and, optionally, a cover image.

This title will be used to identify the division.

If a division-specific cover image is not uploaded, the version’s cover image will be displayed.

Images must be in JPEG format, 300×400 pixels or larger, and less than 150 KiB in size.

If they are larger, reduce the resolution or JPEG compression quality.

If you make a localized version in Catalan, the result will be much nicer.
admin.version_edit.do_not_recreate_stora:
IMPORTANT, READ ME:
This option will only update the MEGA links, but the files will NOT be downloaded to the streaming server and end users will not notice the change. If you have not spoken to an administrator or do not fully understand what this means, please speak to them before enabling this option.
admin.version_edit.download_url_fansub_1: Download link for the original files

Link (URL) to the fansub website listing or to a MEGA folder where the original fansub files can be downloaded.

It is displayed on the listing and is useful to prevent the public from downloading recompressed versions for streaming.

More than one can be added by separating them with a semicolon (no space after it).
admin.version_edit.download_url_fansub_2: Download link for the original files 2

Link (URL) to the second fansub’s website listing or to a MEGA folder where the original files of the second fansub can be downloaded.

It is displayed on the listing and is useful to prevent the public from downloading recompressed versions for streaming.

More than one can be added by separating them with a semicolon (no space after it).
admin.version_edit.download_url_fansub_3: ODownload link for the original files 3

Link (URL) to the third fansub’s website listing or to a MEGA folder where the original files of the third fansub can be downloaded.

It is displayed on the listing and is useful to prevent the public from downloading recompressed versions for streaming.

More than one can be added by separating them with a semicolon (no space after it).
Indicates the archive that has already been uploaded for this episode, or the details of the archive that is selected for upload.
admin.version_edit.episode_list.comments: Usually left empty, but can be used if desired to provide additional information for the public listing (for example, to indicate that there is a problem with the file).
admin.version_edit.episode_list.duration:
The duration of the episode must be specified in hours, minutes, and seconds.

Depending on your locale, your browser may display a time selector in AM/PM format. 00 hours corresponds to 12 AM, 01 to 01 AM, and so on.
admin.version_edit.episode_list.episode_:
Title that will be displayed to the public on the website for this episode.

If episode numbers are not displayed, you must always enter a title.

If numbers are displayed and it is a numbered episode, it is not necessary to enter a title, but if it has one, you must do so.

If it is an unnumbered episode, you must always enter a title.
admin.version_edit.episode_list.help:
This section specifies the titles of each episodes, the variants it has and the MEGA links for each of the variants, along with their resolution and duration.

Normally, episodes only have a single variant, called “Single”, but more can be added and renamed (for example, if the same episode is edited in different dialects, a censored version and one without, etc.).

A MEGA link must be specified for each variant and assigned a resolution, duration and, optionally, a comment.
admin.version_edit.episode_list.help.man:
This section specifies the titles of each episode, the variants it has, and the files for each of the variants.

Normally, episodes only have a single variant, called “Single”, but more can be added and renamed (for example, if the same episode is edited in different dialects, a censored version and one without, etc.).

You must upload a file for each variant and, optionally, assign a comment to it.
admin.version_edit.episode_list.link_and:
You must specify a MEGA link to the episode in the appropriate format (MP4, H264, AAC and subtitles burned into the video) and its resolution. Once the file has been converted and copied to the streaming server, the system will automatically create another link starting with “storage://”, which should not be edited or deleted.

If you want to change the file, you only need to change its MEGA link and the system will detect that it has changed, delete its own link, download and convert it again, and finally add it back.
admin.version_edit.episode_list.lost.hel:
Used to indicate that this variant was published, but has been lost over time.

It is only used in content from old fansubs prior to the creation of %st.

In normal situations, it should always be left unchecked.
admin.version_edit.episode_list.upload.h:
Allows you to select a local archive (ZIP, RAR or CBZ) with the images of this episode to upload.

The contents of the archive will be decompressed and uploaded to the file server.

The archive must contain JPEG or PNG image files and, optionally, an MP3 or OGG audio file that will be played as background music.
Each episode can have different variants (by dialect, style, etc.). Each variant is displayed as a different episode in the public listing and with the variant name indicated.
Under normal conditions, there is usually only one, titled “Single”.
If there is only one variant, the variant name is not displayed anywhere.
admin.version_edit.extra_content.archive: Indicates the archive that has already been uploaded for this extra, or the details of the archive that is selected for upload.
admin.version_edit.extra_content.comment: Usually left empty, but can be used if desired to provide additional information to the public listing (for example, to indicate that there is a problem with the file).
admin.version_edit.extra_content.duratio:
The duration of the extra content must be specified in hours, minutes, and seconds.

Depending on your locale, your browser may display a time selector in AM/PM format. 00 hours corresponds to 12 AM, 01 to 01 AM, and so on.
admin.version_edit.extra_content.help:
Extra content are additional items of the work that are not considered episodes, generally of short duration: openings, trailers, additional content, notes, etc.

The operation of extra content is the same as that of normal episodes, but in this case, there are no variants (if there are any, they can be added as multiple extras). In addition to the same fields as with normal episodes, there is also the “Title” field, which is the title that that specific extra will have.

More can be added by pressing the “Add another extra content” button.
admin.version_edit.extra_content.link_an:
You must specify a MEGA link with the content in the appropriate format (MP4, H264, AAC and subtitles burned into the video) and its resolution. Once the file has been converted and copied to the streaming server, the system will automatically create another link starting with “storage://”, which should not be edited or deleted.

If you want to change the file, you only need to change its MEGA link and the system will detect that it has changed, delete its own link, download and convert it again, and finally add it back.
admin.version_edit.extra_content.title: Title
admin.version_edit.extra_content.title.h: Title that this extra content will have on the public website.
Allows you to select a local archive (ZIP, RAR or CBZ) with the images of this extra content to upload.

The contents of the archive will be decompressed and uploaded to the file server.

The archive must contain JPEG or PNG image files and, optionally, an MP3 or OGG audio file that will be played as background music.
admin.version_edit.fansub_1.help:
Fansub that publishes this version.

If the fansub you want is not there, ask an administrator to add it.

Do not add versions of fansubs other than yours with a user associated with your fansub, or you will not be able to see them once saved.

If it is a collaboration, also fill in the “Fansub 2” and “Fansub 3” fields, if applicable.
admin.version_edit.fansub_2.help:
Second fansub that publishes this version.

Only used in case of collaborations between several fansubs.

If the fansub you want is not there, ask an administrator to add it.
admin.version_edit.fansub_3.help:
Third fansub that publishes this version.

Only used in case of collaborations between several fansubs.

If the fansub you want is not there, ask an administrator to add it.
admin.version_edit.header.liveaction: Edit live action version - Live action
admin.version_edit.header_image.help:
This image will be used in the header of the version listing and also as a background in the recommendations section.

The image must be in JPEG format, 1920×400 pixels or larger, and less than 300 KiB in size.

If it takes up more space, reduce the resolution or JPEG compression quality.
admin.version_edit.localized_title.help:
This title is what will be displayed publicly on the page and corresponds to the title that your fansub gives to this work.

We recommend that it be the title in Catalan, but avoiding unnecessary translations.
admin.version_edit.not_imported.anime: The following items were not imported because they are not in the correct format or because the episodes do not exist in the anime listing. Please add them manually where appropriate. Remember that files are only automatically imported if they are in the format “text - 123text.mp4”.
admin.version_edit.not_imported.liveacti: The following items were not imported because they are not in the correct format or because the episodes do not exist in the live action content listing. Please add them manually where appropriate. Please note that files are only automatically imported if they are in the format “text- 123text.mp4”.
admin.version_edit.not_imported.manga: The following items were not imported because they are not in the correct format or because the episodes do not exist in the manga listing. Please add them manually where appropriate. Remember that files are only automatically imported if they are in the format “text- 123text.mp4”.
admin.version_edit.not_showing_numbers.a: This anime DOES NOT show episode numbers on the public listing. If you want to display the numbers differently than the default, add them where needed.
admin.version_edit.not_showing_numbers.l: This live action content DOES NOT show episode numbers in the public listing. If you want to display the numbers differently than the default, add them where needed.
admin.version_edit.not_showing_numbers.m: This manga DOES NOT show episode numbers in the public listing. If you want to display the numbers differently than the default, add them where needed.
admin.version_edit.original_title.help:
Indicates the work this version is associated with.

It cannot be changed because it is only selected before creating the version.
admin.version_edit.recommendations.help:
Tells the recommendation system whether to recommend this version.

• Never recommend it: It will never appear in featured recommendations.
• Recommend it randomly: It may appear in featured recommendations.
• Always recommend it (special case): It will always appear in featured recommendations. This is intended for when a very notable work is finished and should not remain in this state for more than 4 weeks.
• Always recommend it (seasonal work): It will always appear in featured recommendations. This is intended for works in the process of being published that are currently being broadcast. When they are no longer being broadcast, you must check “Recommend it randomly” again.

If in doubt, select “Recommend it randomly”.
admin.version_edit.remote_folders.accoun: Select the MEGA account (previously registered with your session id) where the uploaded episodes will be checked.
admin.version_edit.remote_folders.divisi:
Division to which the episodes found in this folder will be associated.

It is necessary to specify it if the numbering restarts in each division, because otherwise it would be impossible to know which division the episode belongs to.
admin.version_edit.remote_folders.durati:
Default duration that will be associated with new episodes found in this folder.

Once converted for streaming, it will be corrected to the exact value.
admin.version_edit.remote_folders.folder: Enter the full path to the account folder (for example, “Series/Series name/Season 1/1080p”).
admin.version_edit.remote_folders.help:
This section is optional and allows you to define MEGA accounts and folders to automatically obtain episodes once they are copied there and not have to edit the version in %s.

The retrieval is done every hour by going through these folders and checking if there are new files with filenames that fit a specific pattern and associating them with the corresponding episode.

It is not recommended to use this system if you do not know in detail how it works.

See more information in the administration panel manual and ask an administrator for help if you have any questions.
admin.version_edit.remote_folders.resolu:
Default resolution that will be associated with new episodes found in this folder.

Once converted for streaming, it will be corrected to the exact value.
admin.version_edit.remote_folders.sync.h:
Indicates that synchronization for this folder is enabled and it will therefore be checked every hour for new files.

If disabled, no checks will be made.

It can be left disabled if you only want to manually import it using the “Update links now” button.
admin.version_edit.remote_folders.sync_n: Indicate the type of synchronization desired in this link update: all accounts or only marked ones.
Indicates how episodes will be displayed on the public website.

If numbers are displayed, all numbered episodes will display “Episode X:” before the episode title (if any).

If only titles are displayed, a title must be entered for each uploaded episode, and this title will be the only one displayed.

The versions for “Movie” or “One-shot” content never allow numbers to be displayed.

If the work you are editing uses another word instead of “Episode” (for example, “Song” or “Story”), you must select the option to display only the title and include “Song X:” before each episode title.
admin.version_edit.slug.help:
This auto-generated slug will be part of the URL for this content on the portal.

It is automatically modified when the title or fansubs of the version change.

It is a friendly URL with the format “series-name/fansubs-that-publish-it”.

If it is modified once the version has been created, notify an administrator or the old links will stop working.
admin.version_edit.status.help:
Version publication status by the fansub.

• Completed: Work completed with all content uploaded.
• In progress: Work being published by the fansub.
• Partially completed: There are some seasons completed, but the work is not planned to be continued.
• Abandoned: Work unfinished for a long time without confirmation of cancellation by the fansub.
• Canceled: Work unfinished and formally canceled by the fansub.

The system will prevent saving a version if it is marked as completed without uploading all its episodes, or vice versa: marking it as “In progress” having uploaded all its episodes.
admin.version_edit.status.help.manga:
Version publication status by the fansub.

• Completed: Work completed with all content uploaded.
• In progress: Work being published by the fansub.
• Partially completed: Some important part of it is completed, but the work is not planned to be continued.
• Abandoned: Work unfinished for a long time without confirmation of cancellation by the fansub.
• Canceled: Work unfinished and formally canceled by the fansub.

The system will prevent saving a version if it is marked as completed without uploading all its episodes, or vice versa: marking it as “In progress” having uploaded all its episodes.
admin.version_edit.storage_folder.help: Informative and non-modifiable field that indicates the directory of the storage and streaming servers where the files will be copied.
admin.version_edit.storage_processing.co: Unless instructed to do so by an administrator, you should not change this option, as it will affect file import. Are you sure you want to make this change?
admin.version_edit.storage_processing.he:
Field that defines what is done with the files: whether they are imported keeping a copy on the storage server or not being saved and copied directly to the streaming server.

If in doubt, and unless an administrator tells you otherwise, leave the default option checked.
admin.version_edit.storage_processing.no: Do not keep any copies of the original files
admin.version_edit.storage_processing.sa: Keep a copy of the original files
admin.version_edit.synopsis.help:
Summary of the plot of the work in a maximum of 5 or 6 lines.

If it’s useful to you, you can copy it from other websites or import it from %s, but you must translate it into Catalan.

**bold** and __italics__ are allowed.
admin.version_links.explanation: These are the links to the version of “%1$s” made by %2$s.
admin.version_links.header.liveaction: Live action version links - Live action
admin.version_links.title: Version links
admin.version_list.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete version “%1$s” by %2$s and all its files? This action cannot be undone.
admin.version_list.header.liveaction: Live action version list - Live action
admin.version_list.links.title: Links
admin.version_list.public_page.title: Listing on the public website
admin.version_list.recommendable: Can be recommended by the recommendation system
admin.version_list.stats.title: Statistics and comments
admin.version_stats.explanation: These are the statistics for the version of “%1$s” made by %2$s.
admin.version_stats.header.liveaction: Live action version statistics - Live action
admin.version_stats.title: Version statistics
admin.version_stats.user_comments.explan: This list does not show fansub comments or replies. You can see everything on the public listing.
admin.version_stats.user_comments.title: User comments
admin.views.extra_info: Depending on the technology used, some views do not show progress and appear immediately as completed.
admin.views.extra_info.manga: Depending on the technology used, some readings do not show progress and appear immediately as completed.
admin.views.not_counted: Not currently counted as a view

Join a play session to sync video playback with another person: the other user will have control over playback and you will see the video in sync with them. The host must send you an 8-letter code that you must enter here to join their play session.

To stop sharing, close the player or press the share play session button and select “Stop sharing”.
js.catalogue.player.share_play_dialog_st:
You are watching this video in sync with another user.

If you want to exit from this shared play session, press “Stop sharing”: you will recover control over playback and it will no longer be in sync with the host.

You have control over playback: other users that connect to this session will see the video in sync with you. Copy this code or link and send it to your guests: they will need to enter it to connect to this session.
To stop sharing, press the “Stop sharing” button: other users will no longer be in sync with you and will continue watching the video at their pace.

main.privacy_policy.explanation:
This Privacy Policy defines how %1$s (“we”) collects, stores, uses, maintains and shares information (“information” or “data”) collected from users (each, a “user”, or “you”) of the %1$s website (“Website”). This Privacy Policy applies to all products and services offered by %1$s in connection with the Website (“Services”). If you have any questions regarding this privacy policy or our use of your data, we can resolve them for you by writing to us using the contact link at the bottom of the page.

Information we collect

Personal information you provide us

We collect e-mail addresses, dates of birth, usernames and an encrypted version of passwords, in order to provide you with the website services adapted to the user. You can choose not to create a user account on the website and use it anonymously. We do not collect names, surnames, physical addresses or any other personal information from users.

Information collected automatically

We collect certain information from users when they interact with our website. The information may include operating system version, device model and make, IP address, cookies with session identifiers and technical information about users’ use of our website, such as the flow of events on the website, user-defined website settings, service providers used and other non-identifying information. We do not share information with third parties in any case.

How we use the information

We collect and use user information for the following purposes: to provide you with services; to improve our website; to respond to your inquiries or request more information if you contact us; to provide anonymized statistics of our website, including publicly; to protect our services from attacks or intrusions; to respond to requests from authorities or legal needs.

Where, how and how long information is stored

Our servers are located in the Netherlands. However, we may transfer and/or store data to providers or servers located in other countries, including outside the European Economic Area. If you reside in the European Economic Area, please note that these other countries may not have such restrictive data protection laws. However, we are committed to establishing the necessary measures in accordance with this privacy policy and applicable law.
We adopt appropriate data collection, storage and processing practices, as well as security measures to protect against access, alteration, publication or destruction of data and personal information. However, please note that we cannot guarantee 100% security on the Internet, and that the transmission of your data to our services is at your own risk.
We will only retain your information for as long as it is necessary for the purposes detailed in this privacy policy. In no case will the storage period exceed 2 years. If we no longer need the data, we will delete or anonymize it and, if this is not possible (for example, because it has been stored in backup copies), we will securely archive it and isolate it from any further processing until deletion is possible.

Changes to this privacy policy

This document was last updated on June 22, 2023. We reserve the right to update this privacy policy at any time. When we do, we will modify this last updated date. We recommend that users frequently check this page for changes to stay informed of how we help protect the personal information we collect. You agree that it is your responsibility to review this privacy policy periodically. Your use of the Website or Services after this Policy has been modified constitutes your acceptance of the new Policy.

Rights and contact information

If you reside in the European Economic Area, you have certain rights that you may exercise at any time. Whether you wish to exercise your rights or have questions about this Privacy Policy, our practices, or your interactions with the Website, you may contact the Data Protection Officer using the contact link at the bottom of the page.

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or our use of your information, we can resolve them by writing to us using the contact link at the bottom of the page.
main.who.explanation:
A fansub is a group of one or more people with the hobby of subtitling audiovisual products or translating and editing comics in their language in an altruistic way.
%1$s is a project that emerged from the joint efforts of the main Catalan fansubs. Our sole objective is to promote the consumption of East Asian content in Catalan, while allowing its online viewing, and we believe that this website is one of the ways to achieve this.
The website is a collection of all the content published by the different Catalan fansubs. We do not assess its quality or make any corrections, therefore, be aware that some works may have a lower quality than expected. If you are not satisfied with a particular fansub, you can add it to your personal blacklist to hide its content.

Statement of principles

The operation of %1$s is based on these three principles:
1. Only content that does not exist through official channels: On this portal you will only find content that has not been officially licensed or edited in Catalan.
2. Support for official publications: When we know that a work will be officially published in Catalan, we immediately remove it from the website in order to help its commercialization.
3. Zero economic return: Our work is completely altruistic and this website does not have, and will never have, any advertising of any kind. We do not receive any economic return.
On the other hand, we consider that we are doing a task that, in a normal country, we should not do. The original objective of a fansub is to bring material that is not commercially profitable to the public. Unfortunately, if we talk about East Asian content in Catalan, the works that are likely to fall into this category are almost all, and currently, few publishers, few television channels and few on-demand content services are committed to it.
Some fansubs have explored ways to get the material published officially, but it is not viable without a strong investment in the sector by public entities. For this reason, we have decided to do this work as best we can: during our free time and in a completely altruistic way. The material you will find collected on this portal is the result of that.
We sincerely hope that you enjoy our content, and we would be very happy if you send us comments.

Contact

You can contact us using the button at the bottom of the page. If you want to contact a specific fansub, you can do so through their website or social networks, which you will find on the listing for each content or in the fansubs section.
